means: 悄悄地走，偷偷地走近( sidle的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: He was sidling into the bar, obviously trying to be inconspicuous.
sentence.Network_cn: 他悄悄地走进酒吧，显然不想引起注意。

sentence.Network_en: Another pause, and more eying and sidling around each other.
sentence.Network_cn: 两个人暂停了一会儿, 接着又眼对眼,身子侧身子兜着圈子走了几步.

sentence.Network_en: They broke asunder, sidling out of their benches, leaping them.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们忽然散开来, 有的侧身从凳子前挤出去, 有的从上面一跃而过.

list.abs: Hurstwood nerved himself and sidled near ., 赫斯渥鼓起勇气 , 侧身走近了他.
She sidled out of the crowded room ., 她悄悄地侧身走出那挤满人的房间.
She sidled away ., 她悄悄离去.
sidled through the narrow doorway ., 侧身穿过狭窄的门道.
She sidled away ., 她悄悄离去.

entry.tran: 悄悄地走;小心翼翼地走
entry.def: If you sidle somewhere, you walk there in a quiet or cautious way, as if you do not want anyone to notice you.

example.ex: A young man sidled up to me and said, 'May I help you?'
example.tran: 一个年轻人悄悄走向我说道，“我可以帮你吗？”

example.ex: He was sidling into the bar, obviously trying to be inconspicuous.
example.tran: 他悄悄地走进酒吧，显然不想引起注意。

auth_sentence.content: With the express intent of "writing songs with structure", there's clarity sidling alongside short, clean bouts of energy.
auth_sentence.res_content: With the express intent of "writing songs with structure", there's clarity sidling alongside short, clean bouts of energy.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: With the express intent of "writing songs with structure", there's clarity sidling alongside short, clean bouts of energy.

auth_sentence.content: Sidling down the hallway to the right, you would have reached Shuer's bedroom.
auth_sentence.res_content: Sidling down the hallway to the right, you would have reached Shuer's bedroom.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Sidling down the hallway to the right, you would have reached Shuer's bedroom.

auth_sentence.content: Sidling up to the man she had singled out, Ms. de Margerie writes, she would engage him in conversation.
auth_sentence.res_content: Sidling up to the man she had singled out, Ms. de Margerie writes, she would engage him in conversation.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Sidling up to the man she had singled out, Ms. de Margerie writes, she would engage him in conversation.
